org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game

Class BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.SmallProgressMeasureSolver.Tuple
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple
  • Enclosing class:
    BigStepSolver

    public static class BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple
extends SmallProgressMeasureSolver.Tuple
    This class provides an approximated tuple. The sum of the tuple is limited by a specified number.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai
    See Also:
    SmallProgressMeasureSolver.Tuple

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ApproximateTuple(BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple tuple)
      Initializes this tuple based on a specified tuple.
      ApproximateTuple(Game game, StateSet subgame, GamePlayer player, int max)
      Initializes this tuple for a subgame of a parity game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple clone() 
      BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple getLeastUpperTuple(GameState s)
      Returns the least tuple m such that m ≥p(s) this tuple where p(s) is the parity of the state s, and ≥i is the same as ≥ applied to tuples truncated to the first i elements.
      int getSum()
      Returns the sum of this tuple.
      int getSum(int i, int j)
      Returns the sum of a segment of this tuple.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApproximateTuple

        public ApproximateTuple(Game game,
                        StateSet subgame,
                        GamePlayer player,
                        int max)
        Initializes this tuple for a subgame of a parity game. All elements will be 0 after the initialization.
        Parameters:
        game - a parity game
        subgame - the states of the subgame
        player - the game player which the solver is going to solve the parity game for
        max - the maximum sum of this tuple
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the game is not a parity game

      • ApproximateTuple

        public ApproximateTuple(BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple tuple)
        Initializes this tuple based on a specified tuple.
        Parameters:
        tuple - a tuple

    • Method Detail

      • getSum

        public int getSum()
        Returns the sum of this tuple.
        Returns:
        the sum of this tuple

      • getSum

        public int getSum(int i,
                  int j)
        Returns the sum of a segment of this tuple.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the first element in the segment (inclusive)
        j - the index of the end of the element (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the sum of the specified segment of this tuple

      • clone

        public BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class SmallProgressMeasureSolver.Tuple

      • getLeastUpperTuple

        public BigStepSolver.ApproximateTuple getLeastUpperTuple(GameState s)
        Description copied from class: SmallProgressMeasureSolver.Tuple
        Returns the least tuple m such that m ≥p(s) this tuple where p(s) is the parity of the state s, and ≥i is the same as ≥ applied to tuples truncated to the first i elements. If the parity p(s) is odd, then either the inequality is strict, or m is the top.
        Overrides:
        getLeastUpperTuple in class SmallProgressMeasureSolver.Tuple
        Parameters:
        s - a state
        Returns:
        the least tuple m such that m ≥p(s) this tuple
